name: 9.5mm Pathe-Baby and parents behaving badly
description: A look at the link between the Pathé-Baby system and animation, as well as the relationship between cinematic parents and their children.

key_work.title: 9.5mm Pathé-Baby camera and projector
key_work.brief_description: The Pathé-Baby camera and projector was an inexpensive and easy-to-use amateur film system introduced in 1922. It used 9.5mm film with central perforations.

start.title: Astro Boy
start.brief_description: In the year 2000, Dr. Boyton creates a super-robot in his deceased son’s image. He calls the robot Astro Boy. Astro Boy can swim oceans, leap over mountains, even fly into space on his own power. However, Astro Boy can’t replace his son.

end.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1980
end.brief_description: Jack Torrance accepts a caretaker job at the Overlook Hotel, where he, along with his wife Wendy and their son Danny, must live isolated from the rest of the world for the winter. But they aren’t prepared for the madness that lurks within.

constellations_other.description: The visual effects for Blade Runner drew on a number of techniques from other iconic films, including two of Stanley Kubrick's masterpieces.

links.description: A boy with special powers and uneasy parental relationship is also central to Stanley Kubrick’s The Shinning, with son Danny possessing supernatural powers that help him escape his father. A.I. was also originally a collaboration between Spielberg and Kubrick, but the latter died before it was made.

end.title: Mickey's Choo-Choo
end.brief_description: Mickey is a railroad engineer with an anthropomorphic locomotive. He feeds the train (coal), then feeds his dog, then makes lunch for himself. Minnie drops by and plays a tune on her fiddle while Mickey dances. After lunch, the train has trouble climbing a hill, and the last car with Minnie aboard detaches and runs away.

links.description: The popularity of the Pathé-Baby system, including the home projector, meant that many professional cartoons were released on 9.5mm format. This was one of the earliest ways in which people could bring the beloved mouse mascot into their homes.

links.description: Astro Boy, which began life as the kami-shiki show Mighty Atom in 1957, was the most famous creation from Osamu Tezuka. He was highly influenced by Disney and the western style of animation due to repeatedly watching the reels on his father’s Pathé-Baby 9.5mm projector.
